text:
What is the '->' operator doing?
as in:
```function linear(in, out)
  W = randn(out, in)
  b = randn(out)
  x -> W * x .+ b
end```

elements.text:
What is the '->' operator doing?
as in:

function linear(in, out)
  W = randn(out, in)
  b = randn(out)
  x -> W * x .+ b
end

text: ah, I realized this right as you replied. Thanks.

text:
What kind of animal is “->“? I was wondering where does one define a doctring for such a thing. I tried Meta.@lower and the result is quite obscure to me.
``` julia> Meta.@lower x -> 2
:($(Expr(:thunk, CodeInfo(
    @ none within `top-level scope'
1 ─      $(Expr(:thunk, CodeInfo(
    @ none within `top-level scope'
1 ─      global var"#17#18"
│        const var"#17#18"
│   %3 = Core._structtype(Main, Symbol("#17#18"), Core.svec(), Core.svec(), false, 0)
│        var"#17#18" = %3
│        Core._setsuper!(var"#17#18", Core.Function)
│        Core._typebody!(var"#17#18", Core.svec())
└──      return
)))
│   %2 = Core.svec(var"#17#18", Core.Any)
│   %3 = Core.svec()
│   %4 = Core.svec(%2, %3, $(QuoteNode(:(#= REPL[26]:1 =#))))
│        $(Expr(:method, false, :(%4), CodeInfo(quote
    return 2
end)))
│        #17 = %new(var"#17#18")
└──      return #17
))))```

end)))

text: Possibly julia/base/docs/basedocs.jl although it's not in there I don't think
